title: Philippines: Citibank Opens ATMs in Key Metro Locations
summary: To increase accessibility of its banking services to clients, Citibank recently began setting-up ATM facilities outside of its branches. These ATMs, which can dispense U.S. dollars, are located at Makati Shangri-La Hotel, Seibu Tower in Fort Bonifacio and Shangri-La Plaza in Mandaluyong City.
tag-1: Philippines: Citibank Opens ATMs in Key Metro Locations
tag-2: To increase accessibility of its banking services to clients, Citibank recently began setting-up ATM facilities outside of its branches. These ATMs, which can dispense U.S. dollars, are located at Makati Shangri-La Hotel, Seibu Tower in Fort Bonifacio and Shangri-La Plaza in Mandaluyong City.
tag-3: Clients can withdraw up to $3,000 per day in dollars or pesos, settle utilities and credit card bills, print their last 10 transactions, request a Citibank credit card statement, inquire about foreign exchange rates, and change Citicard or credit card PINs at the Citibank ATMs.
tag-4: "We have started our rollout last year, and we will continue this in 2012. We have another one lined up soon as we aim to provide increased convenience to our bank clients. We make sure our ATMs are strategically placed in high-traffic locations that our clients frequent," said Vipin Agrawal, Retail Banking Director, Citibank Philippines.
tag-5: This initiative forms part of Citibank's thrust to bring unparalleled access and responsiveness, a full suite of global banking services and personalized products and services to clients, particularly the emerging affluent market.
tag-6: The emerging affluent market is rapidly growing in the Asian region with about 500 million individuals whose investible assets range from $10,000 to $100,000. In the Philippines, Citibank is aggressively pursuing this market, inviting clients to begin a banking relationship with 100,000 pesos.
tag-7: Setting industry benchmarks, Citibank's offers include local cash withdrawals – free of transaction fee – via any ATM in the country, "Call Me Back" service, free and real-time Citi Global Transfers of as much as $10,000 daily, cross-border account opening with pre-arrival assistance for expatriates, Global View of Accounts, international cash withdrawals at more than 20,000 Citi ATMs across the globe for travelers free of transaction fee, a dedicated Personal Banker and the Goal Planner Tool for personalized financial planning, among others.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
